text: East Side Story is the fourth studio album by British band Squeeze. It was released on 15 May, 1981 through A&M; Records and went to number 19 in the United Kingdom and number 44 in the United States. ==Track listing== All tracks written by Chris Difford and Glenn Tilbrook except where noted. Side A # "In Quintessence" – 2:55 (Produced by Dave Edmunds, assisted by Neil King) # "Someone Else's Heart" – 3:00 # "Tempted" – 4:02 # "Piccadilly" – 3:26 # "There's No Tomorrow" – 3:27 # "Heaven" – 3:49 # "Woman's World" – 3:42 Side B # "Is That Love" – 2:31 # "F-Hole" – 4:41 # "Labelled with Love" – 4:44 # "Someone Else's Bell" – 3:08 # "Mumbo Jumbo" – 3:13 # "Vanity Fair" – 3:09 # "Messed Around" – 2:42 ===Bonus tracks (1997 reissue)=== # * "The Axe Has Now Fallen" – 3:51 # "Lookin' for a Love" (James Alexander, Zelda Samuels) – 3:00 (Produced by Nick Lowe) ===Bonus tracks (2007 Japanese Remaster)=== # "Trust" – 1:46 # "Yap Yap Yap" – 4:14 == References == Category:1981 albums Category:Squeeze (band) albums
title: East Side Story (Squeeze album)
